definition: Taobao Marketplace, a Chinese website for online shopping
to wash/to clean out/to cleanse/to eliminate/to dredge

sentences.english: The marketing strategy of Taobao makes it easy for customers to know the brand information.
sentences.chinese: 淘宝网的营销活动向目标受众准确传达了品牌信息。

sentences.english: Taobao makes for a nice example of the symbiotic relationship between consumption and innovation.
sentences.chinese: 淘宝网成就了一个创新与消费之间典型关系的范例。

sentences.english: Taobao is run bye-commerce powerhouse Alibaba. com.
sentences.chinese: 淘宝网是由电子商务阿里巴巴网站运作的。

sentences.english: Taobao will take the product off the shelves immediately, a manager said.
sentences.chinese: 淘宝网某经理表示将对该产品立即进行下架处理。

sentences.english: You can purchase brand-named items like Nokia on www. taobao. com.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在淘宝网上买到像诺基亚。

sentences.english: Have you ever do shopping in TaoBao two years ago?
sentences.chinese: 两年前你有使用过淘宝网购物吗？

sentences.english: Here for you to support a few strokes Jiangsu Taobao shop brush single reputation platform method.
sentences.chinese: 下面就为你支几招江苏淘宝网店刷单信誉平台的方法。

sentences.english: You use Alipay to pay the money ever time you shopping on Taobao.
sentences.chinese: 你每次淘宝网购物都会使用支付宝安全付款方式。

definition: brick and mortar business/physical (rather than online) retail store
e-commerce (abbr. for 電子商務|电子商务[dian4 zi3 shang1 wu4])/(old) to negotiate by telegram or telephone
to generate fake transactions in order to game a commercial online platform (one that rewards users who make numerous transactions)
see 商城縣|商城县[Shang1 cheng2 xian4]
online purchase of goods dispatched from overseas
to sell as agent/to sell on commission (e.g. insurance policies)/proxy sale (of stocks)
Ali Baba, character from The Arabian Nights
